sen.j: 老中奉書（ろうじゅう ほうしょ）は、江戸時代の老中が発給する伝達文書。
sen.e: Roju Hosho was the official document issued by roju (a senior councilor of the Tokugawa shogunate) in the Edo period.
Roju Hosho was the official document issued by roju (a senior councilor of the Tokugawa shogunate) in the Edo period.
Roju Hosho was the official document issued by roju (a senior councilor of the Tokugawa shogunate) in the Edo period.

sen.j: 老中が連名で発給する連署奉書と、単独で発給する奉書がある。
sen.e: There were two types of Roju Hosho: the Rensho Hosho issued in the joint names of roju and the Hosho issued by a single roju.
There were two types of Roju Hosho: the Rensho Hosho issued in the joint names of several roju and the Hosho issued by a single roju.
There were two types of Roju Hosho: the Rensho Hosho issued in the joint names of several roju and the Hosho issued by a single roju.

sen.j: 前者の例としては大名や遠国奉行への命令伝達。
sen.e: As the example of the former, there is the Rensho Hosho which was used when roju conveyed the shogun's order to daimyo (Japanese feudal lords) and ongoku-bugyo (the commissioners placed at the demesnes of the Tokugawa shogunate).

sen.j: 後者の例としては将軍家への進物の受け取り確認等があげられる。
sen.e: As the example of the latter, there is the Hosho which was used for the confirmation of receiving the gifts to the shogun family.

sen.j: 寛文4年（1664年）4月1日に制度が改定された。
sen.e: On April 1, 1664, the system was changed.

sen.cmt: 旧暦を西暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 小事については老中一判の奉書となった。
sen.e: For the minor matters, a single signature was added to the roju hosho.
sen.cmt: 「老中一判の奉書」→意味＆定訳が不明ですが、「老中の一つの判が押された奉書」と捉えて訳してあります。
sen.e: For minor matters, a single signature was put to the roju hosho.
sen.cmt: 文法修正と単語の入れ替えを行いました。

sen.j: 宛名には「殿」を用い、発給日は年を記さず月日のみである。
sen.e: The honorific title, "tono" (lord), was added after the name of an addressee and only the month and date were written as the issuing date, without including the year.

sen.j: 例外として、城の修築許可証には年月日が記される。
sen.e: The exception was the license to construct a castle, on which the year, month, and date were described.

sen.j: 差出人となる老中の名は、序列の低い者から順に署名する。
sen.e: The roju's names written as the senders were signed in the ascending order of their ranks.

sen.j: 老中が大名や旗本に宛てて私信を発することもある。
sen.e: Sometimes Roju sent a private letter to daimyo or hatamoto (direct retainers of the Edo bakufu).
